text: The Hauler, designed by Zorgon Peterson, is a freighter produced from 3300 to the present. It costs 52,720 CR with an insurance value of 2,636 CR.

The Hauler is a small freighter with dimensions of 28.6m x 26.2m x 10.4m. It has a hull mass of 14 t, armor of 180 with a hardness of 20, and shields of 65 MJ. Its heat capacity is 123, and it has a fuel capacity of 4 t. The ship has a manoeuvrability rating of 4, a top speed of 203 m/s (default) or 232 m/s (upgraded), and a boost speed of 305 m/s (default) or 348 m/s (upgraded). The unladen jump range is 9.87 ly (default) or 37.29 ly (upgraded), with a cargo capacity of 8 t (default) or 26 t (max).
The Hauler is equipped with 2 utility mounts and 1 small hardpoint. It has internal compartments including 3 class 1, 1 class 2, and 2 class 3 compartments.

The Hauler's default outfitting includes lightweight alloys (class 1), a power plant (class 2), thrusters (class 2), a frame shift drive (class 2), life support (class 1), a power distributor (class 1), sensors (class 1), a fuel tank (class 2), cargo racks (class 2), a shield generator (class 2), an advanced docking computer (class 1), supercruise assist (class 1), and a passenger system (class 1).

The Hauler is designed to haul cargo at a cheap price, with a capacity of 26T. It is a standout exploration ship for low-budget pilots, with potential jump ranges reaching around 40 ly with engineering. However, its low compartment space and small fuel tank make long-term expeditions challenging.

As a mining ship, the Hauler can carry more materials than a Sidewinder or Eagle but mines slowly due to its single hardpoint. It is generally advised to wait for the Adder before attempting mining with the Hauler.

In combat, the Hauler is the least viable option among all ships and ship-launched fighters. With only a single hardpoint, two utility mounts, terrible shielding, and low armor, it is incapable of defending against even a stock Sidewinder.

The Hauler's pilot seat is situated at the front of the ship with a standard view. A single class 1 hardpoint is located at the bottom of the nose, while 2 utility slots are situated atop the rear of the ship.

The Hauler is only slightly less expensive than the Adder, which can carry more cargo and is more capable in various aspects. While the Adder has less jump-range, it can fit a larger fuel scoop and fuel tank, and any added mass has less impact on its jump range.
